Comment: We saw what happens when he gets called out on a simple, provable fact in that interview last week.  He doubled down for nearly two minutes on the concept that the guy we sent to El Salvador has MS-13 tattooed on his knuckles.  He attacked the person interviewing him, questions why the guy couldn't just say Trump was right.  It's absolute insanity.  And yet it works with his base.  Even when it's lies, a switch goes off in their brains that switches them to "this is just entertainment and our side is winning and angering the libs is worth ignoring his lies, only winning the day matters and he wins if I stand with him no matter what."  They relish those interactions, and go big picture "what he says doesn't matter, and it's hilarious the libs are so upset by it."  Even though what he says directly shapes policy, directly informs all those working for him.  He says the guy is MS-13, he falsely claims has the characters M S 1 3 are on the guy's knuckles, he justifies the guy being deported.  Then you'll get low information morons who will defend every word and claim it's not what he said or meant.  They say he was referring to the meaning of the tattoos, not the photoshopped M S 1 3.  They refuse to watch him literally get called out that those characters are photoshopped, and him doubled down on that specific point - the photoshopped characters, not the actual tattoos - and they look the other way and act like it's not what he literally was talking about, with no room for interpretation, for two fucking minutes in arguing.
